meanings.definition: To make colorless or remove color from something.
meanings.sent1: She was achromatizing the painting by removing all the bright colors.
meanings.sent2: The artist was achromatizing the image to create a monochromatic effect.
meanings.sent3: The magician's wand seemed to be achromatizing everything it touched, turning them grayscale.
meanings.sent4: The rain poured down, achromatizing the vibrant flowers into dull shades of gray.
meanings.sent5: The potion had a strange effect, achromatizing the world around the wizard.

meanings.definition: To convert into shades of gray.
meanings.sent1: The old photograph was achromatizing over time, losing its color.
meanings.sent2: The software was achromatizing the image to create a black-and-white version.
meanings.sent3: The artist's brush seemed to be achromatizing the canvas, turning it into a grayscale masterpiece.
meanings.sent4: The storm clouds were achromatizing the sky, darkening it to shades of gray.
meanings.sent5: The world outside the window was achromatizing as the sun set, casting everything in gray tones.
